page.title: 16Ingatestone High Street.
page.content: Ingatestone has developed in a linear fashion along the High Street. The High Street contains most of the shops and businesses of the area; it is a mixture of the old and the new. At the southern end of the High Street are some{almshouses}which have been recently restored; they are run by a Catholic charity and preference is given to retired Catholic clergy. In the middle of the almshouses is a small chapel. There is evidence of old coaching inns with stables in courtyards and numerous old buildings. Ingatestone Parish church is set back slightly from the High Street. In contrast there are new buildings often housing shops on the ground floor with flats above or providing office space. None of the office buildings are particularly large - the largest being the offices of Moody the builder.
